meanings.definition: To guide or lead someone back to a place.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will reconduct the lost student to the classroom.
meanings.sent2: Please reconduct the visitor to the entrance of the museum.
meanings.sent3: The tour guide had to reconduct the distracted group back to the main path.
meanings.sent4: After getting lost in the maze, she had to reconduct herself to the starting point.
meanings.sent5: The kind stranger reconducted the elderly lady to her home when she got lost.

meanings.definition: To lead or guide someone through a process again.
meanings.sent1: The trainer will reconduct the new employee through the safety procedures.
meanings.sent2: Let's reconduct the experiment to ensure accurate results.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reconduct the cooking class after the power outage disrupted the first session.
meanings.sent4: She decided to reconduct the interview to delve deeper into the candidate's qualifications.
meanings.sent5: The coach reconducted the team through the winning strategy before the championship game.
